com.group31.database

Class DatabaseConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.group31.database.DatabaseConnector

  • public class DatabaseConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that handles all operations with the database within the program. This class uses MySQL flavor of the SQL to operate on a database. Please refer to the documentation included with the project submission in order to setup the database for the program to use. Note that at most one instance of DatabaseConnector should exist in program. Having more can create unexpected behavior and will result in a crash, as two simultaneous accesses to database raise SQLException.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatabaseConnector()
      Creates an instance of DatabaseConnector that connects to the database using the specified static parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEntry(Entry entry)
      Inserts a given Entry into the today_meals table of the database.
      void cleanUp()
      Cleans up the database by deleting all old entries from today_meals and converting them to the entries of day_statistics.
      java.util.List<Entry> getDailyStatistics()
      Returns an array of type Entry that is stored in day_statistics table
      Entry[] getTodayStatistics()
      Returns an array of type Entry that is stored in today_meals table
      void removeEntry(Entry entry)
      Removes an Entry from table today_meals

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • DatabaseConnector

        public DatabaseConnector()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates an instance of DatabaseConnector that connects to the database using the specified static parameters. Note that at most one instance of DatabaseConnector should exist in com.group31.application
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error with connecting to database

    • Method Detail

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Cleans up the database by deleting all old entries from today_meals and converting them to the entries of day_statistics.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error with connecting to database

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(Entry entry)
              throws java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        entry - an Entry to insert into
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error with connecting to database
